Basic Concepts and Definitions on Sequences
p, a prime; n, a positive integer; q = pn. f (x ), a polynomial function from Fq to Fp.

If a is also balanced, then we say that a has an (ideal) 2-level autocorrelation function. When N = q 1 and a f (x ), a has 2-level autocorrelation if and only if
f (x ) is called an orthogonal function from Fq to Fp.

G. Gong (University of Waterloo) New Integer Valued 2-Level AC Sequences 2009 12 / 41
In general, for any integer pair (v , t), for x Fq , a value of fh(v , t)(x ) may be just a complex number. If
then we can construct a function, say g(x ), from Fq to Fp, whose elements are given by

In this case, we say that (v , t) is realizable, and g(x ) is a realization of f (x ). Hadamard Equivalence: If g(x ) is realized by f (x ), then g(x ) and f (x ) are Hadamard equivalent respect to h(x ).
G. Gong (University of Waterloo) New Integer Valued 2-Level AC Sequences 2009 13 / 41
Important remark For two functions which are Hadamard equivalent, if one of them has 2-level autocorrelation, so does the other.
G. Gong (University of Waterloo) New Integer Valued 2-Level AC Sequences 2009 14 / 41

The second-order DHT, bfh(7, 7) and bfh(7, 5), are given by bfh(7, t)() = X
Thus, (7, 7) is not a realizable pair, while (7, 5) is a realizable pair which realizes the sequence 011 of period 3.
G. Gong (University of Waterloo) New Integer Valued 2-Level AC Sequences 2009 16 / 41
Hadamard Equivalent Classes for Known 2-Level Autocorrelation Sequences
Experimental results on the realizations of all the known p-ary sequences with 2-level autocorrelation of period pn 1 have been done:
Binary case: for odd n 17 (Gong-Golomb, 2002), and even n 16 (Yu-Gong, 2005, 2009).
Ternary Case: for odd n 15 (Ludkovski-Gong, 2001, Gong-Helleseth, 2004).
G. Gong (University of Waterloo) New Integer Valued 2-Level AC Sequences 2009 17 / 41

New Integer Valued Sequences with 2-Level Autocorrelation Constructed from DHT
The sequence {si} is not a realization, but it is an integer sequence with 2-level autocorrelation!
G. Gong (University of Waterloo) New Integer Valued 2-Level AC Sequences 2009 19 / 41
Construction of New Integer Valued Sequences
For integers 0 < v , t < q 1, we define the sequence s(v , t) = {si} by
si = fh(v , t)( i ), si = s
Then s(v , t) is an integer valued sequence for p = 2 and a complex valued sequence for p > 2. s(v , t) is normalized from s(v , t).
G. Gong (University of Waterloo) New Integer Valued 2-Level AC Sequences 2009 20 / 41

Theorem 1 Let p = 2, n be an odd integer, 1 k < n with gcd(k , n) = 1, and
f (x ) = h(x ) = Tr (x ). Let v = 2n1 1, and t = 2k + 1. Then s(v , t) has two-level autocorrelation, and the si s take three distinct values 1, 0, or 2.
G. Gong (University of Waterloo) New Integer Valued 2-Level AC Sequences 2009 26 / 41

Using the following lemma, we can obtain the element distribution of s(v , t).
Property. Let f (x ) = h(x ) = Tr (x ), and two integers 0 < v , t < 2n 1 satisfy gcd(vt, q 1) = 1. Then we have
G. Gong (University of Waterloo) New Integer Valued 2-Level AC Sequences 2009 35 / 41

Construction: Let n be an integer, and 1 k < n with gcd(k , n) = d and n/d is odd. Let f (x ) = h(x ) = Tr (x ), v = 2n1 1, and t = 2k + 1. Then s(v , t) has ideal two-level autocorrelation, and the si s take at most four distinct values 1, 0, 1, or 2d .
G. Gong (University of Waterloo) New Integer Valued 2-Level AC Sequences 2009 36 / 41

The new ternary sequences yield new Hadamard matrixes with entries {1, 0, 2}. Using the standard construction from binary 2-level autocorrelation sequences to Hadamard matrices, let
where AT is the transpose of A and I is the identity matrix of q by q (q = 2n).
Similarly, we have new 2n 2n Hadamard matrixes with entries {1, 0, 1, 2}.

How to prove the other ternary or quaternary sequences with two-level autocorrelation from the second order DHT of binary sequences (shown by experiments)? Are all the binary 2-level autocorrelation sequences from the second order DHT of binary sequences (at least the experimental results confirm it)? How to prove conjectured ternary 2-level autocorrelation sequences from the second order DHT of ternary sequences? How to determine analogue classes of p-ary 2-level autocorrelation sequences for p > 3?
G. Gong (University of Waterloo) New Integer Valued 2-Level AC Sequences 2009 41 / 41
